definition: to wish/to express good wishes/to pray/(old) wizard
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: When does the birthday party take place?
sentences.chinese: 生日慶祝會什麼時候舉行？

sentences.english: The interest of all the students converged upon the celebration.
sentences.chinese: 全體學生的興趣都集中於慶祝會。

sentences.english: It is a "world wide celebration of Free and Open Source Software and the community behind it."
sentences.chinese: 這是“自由與開源軟件以及背後社區的全球慶祝會。”

sentences.english: Finally, celebration in the same song "the song ended."
sentences.chinese: 最後，慶祝會在《同一首歌》這首歌曲中結束了。

sentences.english: The celebration in heaven is going to be an amazing thing and Jesus invites you to be a part of it.
sentences.chinese: 天堂裏的慶祝會正變得讓人驚奇，耶穌邀請你加入。

sentences.english: They have painted the city up for the celebration.
sentences.chinese: 他們爲了慶祝會已把該市油漆一新。

sentences.english: You will find a record of all the past years' celebrations of the IDD here too.
sentences.chinese: 你也會找到關於往年國際民主節慶祝會的記錄。

sentences.english: When Mrs. Wang got a promotion at work, she decided to have a celebration.
sentences.chinese: 當王太太獲得工作的升遷時，她決定舉辦一個慶祝會。

sentences.english: The classroom was dolled up by the pupils for the celebration .
sentences.chinese: 爲了這次慶祝會學生們把教室佈置得漂漂亮亮。

sentences.english: Halaby hoked up a special ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 哈拉比勉強拼湊了一場慶祝會。

sentences.english: They do this for a local celebration that is held each year.
sentences.chinese: 他們這樣做是爲了當地每年一次的慶祝會。

sentences.english: This seminar is a great tie-in with our anniversary celebrations.
sentences.chinese: 這個研討會和我們的年度慶祝會是很好的搭配。

sentences.english: We're having a little get-together to celebrate David's promotion.
sentences.chinese: 我們正爲大衛的晉升開一個小型慶祝會。
